comments:
Build ID: I20070503-1400

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Start Eclipse without internal browser available (Linux without Mozilla installed or without MOZILLA_FIVE_PATH)
2. Navigate to Preferences -> Java -> Code Style -> Clean Up
3. See broken widgets, and press various buttons
4. Eclipse crashes with SWT error



More information:
As the internal browser support is optional (everything  works without internal browser so far) preferences page must not use internal browser without checking and falling back to the pre-M7 behavior.

Here is the error message from the log file:

Have to change to StyledText here anyway. Martin, just for the records, can you attach a screen shot of the page how it looks like on vista?

Created an attachment (id=66647)
fix

Use StyledText
Martin? I think I should better use some system default color for enabled/disabled. But I can't find the constants.

Created an attachment (id=66663)
updated patch

I didn't find a better solution for the 'disabled' color. But I simplified the code so you don't need to reference the normal foreground and background color.

I also added a copyright for the new file

Your patch looks good, can I release it for RC1? 

See Bug 186161 for the missing copyright issue...

Aahh, sorry, I see you set the review flag to + on the attachment.

Fixed > I20070508-0800
You should use SWT.COLOR_WIDGET_BACKGROUND for "disabled" background instead of SWT.COLOR_GREY.
Sebastian: could you file issue with disabled background color as separate bug, to make sure it won't be lost?
